Topic.Title: Breaking news! Project Shield, Project Denver, Project Boulder, & Project Phoenix from Jen!

Message.Msg: It's always a joke when you post!

Topic.Title: Breaking news! Project Shield, Project Denver, Project Boulder, & Project Phoenix from Jen!

Message.Msg: Wrong. Only this post is. The rests are facts and observations. Oh. Talking about joke. Nvidia share price is a joke. Lots of promises, average delivery. U? No need to be defensive over Nvidia, or saying Nvidia is a great company. Always let share price do the talking. U invest to make money, or watch it do nothing? Say Nvidia is great when it share price breaks up and stay up. The period it does is the time I change tune to say that Nvidia is a great company. Now, the fact is ain't . Nvidia has not performed for years. Its a POS til it stays above $13 for starters.

Topic.Title: Breaking news! Project Shield, Project Denver, Project Boulder, & Project Phoenix from Jen!

Message.Msg: Once again, argue based on the merits of the facts. Argue my points. Not ranting like a kid that loses an argument. But I am afraid u cant, cos the facts are clear. U have wasted much time hoping on a rise instead of actually making money. Why I said that? Cos Nvidia din perform for years. I have hurt your feelings and ego, hence u rant instead of arguing based on facts. So whether to grow up or stay as a kid, u decide.

Topic.Title: Once again, a lack of follow through

Message.Msg: "It's not out. It's been stated by Nvidia that it would be late by a quarter due to a decision to dedicate resources to the T4i so it could be pushed-up by 2 months. Perhaps the delay was due in part to the latest rumor posted by ibexx today in regards to the Xiaomi M3 that will come equipped with Nvidia’s T4i chip?" roflol, pumper boyz spilling lies, eh I meant rumors, so fast and furious, they can't even keep track of keeping stories straight anymore. Xiaomi to launch Xiaomi Mi3 with Tegra4, LTE, 4.5" screen in mid 2013 SOURCE: maxdioDOTcom/xiaomi-to-launch-xiaomi-mi-3-with-tegra-4-lte-4-5-screen-in-mid-2013/ Xiaomi to launch Xiaomi MI-3 , After the Xiaomi M2 successor which was only recently announced, the Beijing based phone maker are already working on the details of its successor the Xiaomi M3. According to the latest rumors, he Xiaomi M3 will come equipped with Nvidia’s latest quad-core chip, the 4 CPU will offer a quad-core Cortex-A15 CPU with clock speeds between 1.8 GHz and 2 GHz with...... One day, nvda/Tegra/Jen and txn/OMAP/Txn management will make a pair of classic mba classic classroom case studies: both targeted a market segment, the high end app processor market, that does not exist. The good management admitted their mistake, backed off and retargeted and lived/made money ever after. The bad management who was all hype kept losing shareholders' money to the bitter end.

Topic.Title: Once again, a lack of follow through

Message.Msg: TI basically admitted that they can no longer compete on the high end. If money can be made in the lower end, the leader in the high end can effectively compete by tweaking past versions. What don't you understand about that?

Topic.Title: Breaking news! Project Shield, Project Denver, Project Boulder, & Project Phoenix from Jen!

Message.Msg: Can you try to explain the following statement in a way that I can understand? "Why I said that? Cos Nvidia din perform for years." Please get some professional help.

Topic.Title: Once again, a lack of follow through

Message.Msg: "If money can be made in the lower end, the leader in the high end can effectively compete by tweaking past versions. What don't you understand about that?" for those new to the board: that's another lie that the pumper boyz like to spread here. lol, next thing you know, they will be telling you that nvda is doing $hundreds of M of Tegra 1/2 sales. More than there's money to be made, but the only money to be made is in the low end because in the high end, For the high end app proc market: he top 2 mobile names roll their own, #3 is cheap only, and #4 likes to spread the wealth. Ala, there is no high end app proc market to build a business upon. Hence txn bit the bullet, and shifted their focus to other market segments. Nvda, nvda, with that CEO with the huge ego, gallantly soldiers on with your money. The money to be made will be made by guys with the fully integrated solutions. Fully integrated solutions for lower BOM cost, much much faster time to market, and much much less engineering cost up front. Ala, low end cell phones will be just board + solder: buy the app proc, build with reference design, throw in latter google + proven reference design sw provided by the app proc guy, and you are in the phone business. For that low end market, you need all the IPs to build the integrated solution with. Only two companies have all those 'cheap' radios under one roof. None of the others like nvds, intc, samsung, mediatek, txn, renasas, or the 6 other cell phone chip guys in china has all the ip. There, there you have it, a breakdown of the app proc market. Whether it's T4, T5 or T6 will change that nor be successful in that. Now just watch Mr. ctown go nuts and go back to his foul mouth.

Topic.Title: Yes Ladies and Gentlemen, It's Up To Project Shield

Message.Msg: From the 2012 Annual Report - 10K: "During fiscal years 2013, 2012 and 2011, we granted approximately 7.1 million, 6.4 million and 5.8 million stock options, respectively, with estimated total grant-date fair values of $38.3 million, $52.4 million and $34.4 million, respectively, and weighted average grant-date fair values of $5.38, $8.16 and $5.89 per option, respectively. During fiscal years 2013, 2012 and 2011, we granted approximately 8.1 million, 7.3 million and 7.1 million RSUs, respectively, with estimated total grant-date fair values of $112.8 million, $119.7 million and $96.7 million, respectively, and weighted average grant-date fair values of $13.86, $16.31 and $13.61 per RSU, respectively." ___________________________________________________________________________ If you are a Nvidia employee you gotta love those RSUs. Stock doesn't even have to go up and yes, your always in the money because your basis is ZERO. Gee is that aligning with shareholder values. I don't know, but I have to ask where is the incentive with all these RSUs. Perhaps it takes these things to keep all those Senior VP's and the CEO happy.
